[h1] "They're waiting for you, Gordon. In the Test Chamber." [/h1]
[b] Scores [/b]
Narrative: ★★★★★ (Just a normal day in the Black Mesa Research Facility. You play as Gordon Freeman. A man with a P.h.D in badassery... And theoretical physics).
Gameplay: ★★★★★ (Shooting interdimensional creatures and Marines has never been more fun).
Atmosphere: ★★★★★ (I hear Xen is kind of warm this time of the year).
Music: ★★★★★ (You know the music is great when even the special suit comes with its own theme).
Replayability: ★★★★★ (They say that if you play it 3 times in a row, a new game is confirmed).
Conclusion: λ/10.
PS: [spoiler] You've got to watch them.
Be quick or be dead.

After watching a "Let's Play" of the new Half Life: ALYX on the Valve Index I needed to jump back into the HL series. It has been many years since I have played any of the HL series (minus CS:GO) and it welcomed me back with open arms.

The puzzles (figuring out where to go next) at just as challenging as I remember the first time I played - had me back tracking more than once and I still get jump scared in some of the parts (I am a bit of a wuss).

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that is looking to reignite a bit of nostalgia - or anyone that wants to dip their toes into some good old 90's FPS
great game, fun to beat during two back to back all nighters

It's Half Life. Need I say more?

Half-Life has been praised for decades now, and there is very little I can add to that narrative. Yes, Half-Life was revolutionary, but yes Half-Life is a game from a 1998 and it shows in more than just it's polygon count. Despite that, Half-Life excels at level/world design and gun-play, making it timeless. Black Mesa is the greatest fps environment still to this date. Every section feels unique and tells its own engaging story with incredibly thin dialogue, and each level builds off the next. To compliment this, enemies are placed perfectly and the types are varied enough to keep the game evolving with you as you gain a heftier arsenal. Each weapon proves to provide some use throughout the campaign all elevated by the optimal sound design that feeds into the chunkiness of the era. 

I started playing Half-Life as nothing more than a history lesson; to see what all the fuss was about and to judge how far we've come. What I learned is that I get it. Half-Life is a masterpiece. Half-Life was and still is revolutionary. And most importantly, Half-Life continues to withstand the test of time in 2020.
It is fun even though it is old

O que falar sobre Half-Life? Uma obra-prima do mundo dos jogos, ainda quando esse ainda se formava, principalmente para pcs. Jogos de arma já existiam, e muitos por sinal, na verdade gosto de me lembrar do jogo de armas mais antigo que já joguei Tin Stars, em um autentico snes, não diria que é muito bom, porque aquele jogo é difícil. Mas half-life inova no pc, um jogo considerado antigo para pcs, e que dele surgiu três dos jogos mais jogados da steam, mas vamos falar primeiramente do jogo em si.

Em Half-Life você é um cara chamado Gordon Freeman, um cara que na teoria nem sabe usar armas, isso depende de você afinal, e o mesmo foi chamado para realizar um teste para ir para um "outro universo", você pega sua armadura, bem OP por sinal, e no vai fazer o que os cientistas pendem, e se fosse tudo ocorrer bem, ia ser muito chato, então da muita bosta, explode as caceta tudo, e dai os monstros desse outro universo começam a vir para Terra, claro que eles te atacam, claro que você tem que matar eles, depois você descobre que os soldados também querem te matar. Eu dei só uma sinopse.

Enfim, quero encurtar aqui então vou falar quais são os mods mais famosos de Half-Life, COUNTER FUCKING STRIKE e TEAM FUCKING FORTRESS, ué mas não eram três? Bem temos Garry's Mod, que não é um mod, mas também só existe graças a esse jogo lindo.

Jogabilidade: 8/10 Temos alguns bugs, que até existem em outros jogos que usam o mesmo motor de Half-Life, mas mesmo assim é muito bom.

Gráficos: 6/10 Eu sei que o jogo é de antes de 2000, mas mesmo assim são bonitos para a sua época, mas a nota cai porque este review é de 2020 não de 1999.

Lore: 10/10 Diferente de Portal, a Valve soube muito bem como explorar o universo de Half-Life, e apesar de muitas vezes você ficar fazendo as coisas sem saber porquê, você pode ver um vídeo no youtube e depois dizer: "Nossa era isso então"

Невероятная игра. По сложности обходит все последующие части, больше многообразие оружия/противников, гигантские локации. Геймплей иногда заставляет решать невозможно сложные задачи, решение которых придёт далеко не сразу. И всё без подсказок. Отличное начало великой истории

Au moment où j'écris cette évaluation, je suis confiné comme tout le monde. J'ai donc décidé d'installer Half-Life (que j'avais laissé tomber) sur mon ordinateur de travail car il est obselète : Windows 10 fait sauter le disque dur lol. En jouant, j'ai compris qu'il méritait son titre de classique du genre.

Le jeu est vivant : les scientifiques qui parlent, essayent de s'en sortir ou les officiers qui sert à quelque chose. Je les compare à Yoshi dans Mario. Ils t'aident à tuer les ennemis et tu peux les tuer si tu progresse comme ça.

L'IA est intelligente, chose rare encore aujourd'hui dans les jeux récents : elle n'hésitera pas à se déplacer pour se mettre à couvert ou pour vous tuer. Il y a même un gars qui m'a envoyé une grenade alors que j'étais au-dessus 8-)

Le jeu est aussi de l'exploration et de la survie car vous reviendriez sur vos pas pour trouver le chemin à suivre ou progresser et car vos PV se régénère pas avec le temps. Et si vous êtes comme moi, vous allez finir par utiliser la console car vous tournez en rond.

Le jeu possède un mode multijoueur classique avec les armes du jeu. Les parties sont intenses, je dirais, mais seul 2 ou 3 serveurs sont actifs.

Pour avoir testé, le jeu n'est pas trop maniable à la manette (testé avec le Steam Contrôleur)

Je vous le recommande chaudement si vous en avez marre des FPS d'aujourd'hui. Quoi que si il était sorti cette année, Activision aurait dû mettre la clé sous la porte ou faire pareil.

This game speaks for itself, it's Valves breakout title that set a new standard for linear single player games. The combination of a cool and mysterious storytelling, interesting puzzles that take full advantage of the setting, and fast paced action that leads you into the next area with such finesse that I can't think of many games, if any, that do it as well or better. This is a must play game that has so many influential aspects that found their way into the gaming industry. A true masterpiece.
